blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling river package behavior and output.

variables.name: AUXILIARY
variables.description: Defines auxiliary variable names to be associated with each river entry.
variables.tooltip: One or more names of auxiliary variables read with each river entry. Can be used for transport concentrations or user-defined data.

variables.name: AUXMULTNAME
variables.description: Name of the auxiliary variable to be used as a multiplier for the river conductance.
variables.tooltip: The named auxiliary variable is multiplied by COND to compute the actual river conductance.

variables.name: BOUNDNAMES
variables.description: Keyword to activate reading of boundary names for each river cell.
variables.tooltip: When specified, each river entry can include an optional text name for grouping in budget reporting and observations.

variables.name: PRINT_INPUT
variables.description: Keyword to print river input data to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, river data read for each stress period is echoed to the listing file.

variables.name: PRINT_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to print river flow rates to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, computed river flow rates are printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save river flow terms to the cell-by-cell budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, river flow terms are written to the binary budget file for post-processing.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data specifying river cell locations, stages, conductances, and bottom elevations.

variables.name: CELLID
variables.description: Cell identifier for the river location (layer, row, column for DIS; layer, cell2d for DISV; node for DISU).
variables.tooltip: Identifies the model cell containing the river reach. Rivers can both add (gaining reach) and remove (losing reach) water from the model.

variables.name: STAGE
variables.description: River stage (water surface elevation), in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The elevation of the river water surface. When the aquifer head is above the stage, the river gains water from the aquifer. When the head is below, the river loses water to the aquifer.

variables.name: COND
variables.description: Hydraulic conductance of the riverbed, in units of length squared per time.
variables.tooltip: Controls the rate of flow between the river and the aquifer. Computed as K_bed * L * W / M where K_bed is riverbed hydraulic conductivity, L is reach length, W is river width, and M is riverbed thickness.

variables.name: RBOT
variables.description: Elevation of the bottom of the riverbed, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: When the aquifer head drops below RBOT, the seepage rate from the river becomes constant (no longer increases with declining head). This prevents unrealistic leakage rates when the aquifer disconnects from the river.
